item.title: Can anyone portforward a server or .jar it for me?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:4, topic:551384”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670299.msg4482326#msg4482326 date=1431041404]

If you can’t even port forward then you shouldn’t even be “making” a server in the first place.

Everyone starts from somewhere. It’s not like you’re born with the ability to portforward. You have to learn it at some point in your life.[/quote]
True, but I learnt how to port forward by reading one of the unlimited tutorials out there. As I’m sure most people did. The OP shouldn’t have posted such a pointless post when there are tutorials that are good enough for a baby to understand. Also the fact he mentioned Jarring his client in the server section doesn’t really help his case much either.

I don’t want to start bashing the guy, but i’m just being honest here
[/quote]
The point was how you stated what you stated sounded exactly like you were bashing him.

There’s a lot more than tutorials out there. Also, not every tutorial covers every router.
I remember when I had a netgear router some years ago. I tried and tried to portforward the thing, I followed every which guide, it wouldn’t port forward. I found this application to auto port forward (called SimplePortForwarding), and watched it run. It did literally everything I did (The program opens a browser and types the data in. it’s pretty cool). Then I ran a port check, the port was open.
I don’t know what it changed, but it made it work. (Note: I no longer have that router)

Read full topic
item.source: Can anyone portforward a server or .jar it for me?

item.title: Can anyone portforward a server or .jar it for me?
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:551384”][Quote author=Welliton_inc link=topic=670299.msg4482248#msg4482248 date=1431006785]
If you can’t even port forward then you shouldn’t even be “making” a server in the first place.[/quote]
Everyone starts from somewhere. It’s not like you’re born with the ability to portforward. You have to learn it at some point in your life.
[/quote]
True, but I learnt how to port forward by reading one of the unlimited tutorials out there. As I’m sure most people did. The OP shouldn’t have posted such a pointless post when there are tutorials that are good enough for a baby to understand. Also the fact he mentioned Jarring his client in the server section doesn’t really help his case much either.

I don’t want to start bashing the guy, but i’m just being honest here

item.title: Can anyone portforward a server or .jar it for me?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

  1. There’s a million tutorials out there for this… Have you even looked at one?

  2. What part of portforwarding are you stuck on?

If you can’t even port forward then you shouldn’t even be “making” a server in the first place.

Everyone starts from somewhere. It’s not like you’re born with the ability to portforward. You have to learn it at some point in your life.

Read full topic
